name: Springhill Suites Marriott Salt Lake City Airport

reviews.text: Our family with 2 young boys spent a night here in July 2012 while on our way home. The room was great and our boys thought it was one of the coolest rooms they ever stayed in. The room had a great design and decorating to it. It was very clean and spacious. It had a sitting area with a large desk which would be great for the business person. There was a glass partition that seperated that area from the beds. The beds had duvet covers, which I tend to hope are cleaner than the normal bedspread. The room had two bathrooms that had pocket doors - one had a sink and shower/tub and the other had the toilet and another sink. Both pocket doors had a frosted glass inlay to provide light. The room also came with a frig and a microwave. The breakfast was very good - both good hot and cold choices. There was plenty of room in the breakfast area and nothing was lacking. We did not use the pool. Considering location near the airport, it was also a very quiet hotel.
reviews.title: Nice suprise

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in August and September 2012. The night before we were at a full service Marriott that didnt work well for a family and came with a $15 charge of rollaway. We like Spring Hill the best as the rooms work great for a family as you have two bathrooms and a living room area with fridge and microwave. We had no complaints for our stay and downtown Salt Lake is not too far away. Breakfast is not fantastic but adequate. Room was clean.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: What a great, redesigned concept hotel for truly great price. We had 15 of us total and no one had a single negative issue. What a great family getaway. A bigger hotel pool would be great. We did most of our swimming at the pool next door where one of our sons was staying. Not enough of an issue to change my opinion.
reviews.title: Fun

reviews.text: This neighborhood of hotels just west of the SLC Airport is convenient to the airport if you arrive late or have to leave early, but there is nothing else there for the simple pleasures of life. This hotel is OK for the price. I like the roominess, but my biggest complaint was that the thermostat was in the sitting area and the AC/heater blew across the bed and had little impact on the thermostat. The room was warm when I first entered, but if you turned down the thermostat, you would freeze in bed from the icy wind blowing across you. Very poor design.
reviews.title: Close to airport, but isolated
Great stay!
reviews.text: Loved this hotel! The furnishings are so pretty and fesh! The breakfast bar was so yum! By far one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at! The hotel staff was so friendly! I highly recommend staying here!!

We stayed here on our way home from a family location. The front desk staff are very nice. The room is perfect. The bathrooms have an Asian flair with sliding doors. A toilet and sink are separate from the (large) shower and another sink. The rooms have a kitchenette (micro, fridge, sink, and place settings). We enjoyed the pool - small but nice. The breakfast in the morning has a good variety and we found something we liked. They were building another wing in front of the existing building and we were momentarily confused. But we had a good laugh and were very happy with the hotel.
reviews.title: Gear rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel the last night of a multi-week western vacation. We stayed (at a different hotel) in Salt Lake City the first night of our vacation and have to say that this one was far better than the first for about $20 less. The hotel feels updated and modern. The pictures on their website are fairly true to life. Our king suite was clean and spacious. We had to leave too early in the morning to be able to sample their hot buffet breakfast, but we were grateful that they had the cold food out earlier than the hot, and we were able to grab a bite to eat before heading back to the airport. We were also able to print our boarding passes for free on their lobby computer. Room noise was average, except for a tractor trailer with a very loud engine that was parked in the parking lot not far from our window for some unknown reason in the middle of the night. (it wasn't there in the morning). Overall, we felt value was good and stay was comfortable. This hotel would definitely make the short list if we were to travel to SLC again sometime in the future.
reviews.title: Roomy, comfortable and surprisingly affordable

reviews.text: Nice hotel, newer and mixed in with lots of other hotels all around. Has great staff and nice decor. Room was great, toilet separate from shower, both with frosted doors. Desk separated by frosted sliding glass windows, bed comfortable. Has a nice workout room and pool, but no hottub. Can't comment on breakfast as I left too early, but there was some cold continental items if I wanted. Ate at Roberts Restaurant, which was close by, good food with friendly service.
reviews.title: Nice place to rest

reviews.text: I stayed for two nights, one for business one for pleasure...both nights very good. Only complaint would be the AC unit was always on and despite setting temp at 70 it never shut off...if you put the address into your navigation unit you will find this hotel...if you dont have nav...you may go around the block a few times...
reviews.title: Not easy to find but worth a look

reviews.text: Have stayed at this hotel twice; both times at the end of a trip when I was wanting to be near the airport for an early morning flight. Arrived late; front desk patient and helpful. No close parking ( lot full) because we got there so late. Interior decorated in a funky modern aqua scheme which I love but husband doesn't like. Traveling with 1 adult and 1 teenager; great divided bathroom...one could shower while another used sink/toilet area. Left hotel at 6 am; unfortunately breakfast doesn't start until later, but we were able to have English muffins, juice, bananas, bagels or cereal, which was great because I expected to get nothing. My hope is to get to spend some time at this hotel during the daylight hours sometime! I agree with previous reviewer that it is hard to find, but I think it's worth the search.
reviews.title: Return customer

reviews.text: Zero signage from the road. Hides behind a renovation project known as the Hilton garden inn. If you try and drive towards it, you may hit a construction barrier. If you make a wrong turn, you're dropped back on the highway.
reviews.title: Impossible to find.

reviews.text: My gps took me to the holiday inn and suites which looked much nicer.
reviews.title: Spacious and comfortable room for weary travelers

reviews.text: We stayed here after our flight was cancelled and the airline comped the room. So, I can't speak to the value because for us, it was free.
reviews.title: Overnight rest

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and modern and very well maintained. The staff is helpful, friendly, and very attentive.
reviews.title: Two nights in Salt Lake City / pre-flight

reviews.text: Our room was comfortable and spacious with a separate small sitting area. The toilet, shower, and two sinks are all separate units....not in one traditional bathroom. That was a huge benefit for us while getting ready. The beds were incredibly comfortable. The AC worked wonderfully in the SLC heat.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in October, bookending our stay near Lehi, Utah (at the SpringHill Suites in Thanksgiving Point). The proximity to the airport cannot be beat. The place seems very new, with fresh contemporary furnishings and decor. The lounge and eating areas are very spacious and hip, and the breakfasts in the morning were delish. When we were there, they had a frittata-type egg dish and fried slices of ham, oatmeal with various dried fruits and nuts, and lots of fruit salad (fresh strawberries) and bananas/oranges/apples, cereal, bread, bagels, etc. There were even tiny individual glass jars of strawberry preserves and packages of Nutella - so ridiculously cute.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: Our room looked like the hotel photos, although if you have two beds in the room, there is no wardrobe in the room (there is a regular closet). The rooms with a king bed have a wardrobe and wooden bench type thing over the ac unit, and spacious shower (the double bed setup seems to have a bathtub). If those things matter to you, you might want to contact the hotel to specify.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay near airport

reviews.text: No bar sink with the minifridge, but there are two sinks (there is a half bath separated from a room with the bath/shower and another sink) so no biggie.
reviews.title: Will be back...

reviews.text: The living room area had a roomy sectional which was nice, and a decent desk (note, the divider between the desk area and the bedroom can be opened). The bed was comfortable and all in all, we enjoyed our stay here. We just needed a place to crash post- and pre-flights into/out of SLC but this place provided a welcome respite!
reviews.title: If You Have an Early Flight....

reviews.text: I was put up here by Delta after missing my flight home. Overall it is a very stylish hotel and my room was beautiful. Staff was courteous. Breakfast was free and had many above average touches. Any hotel that has nutella packets on the breakfast buffet rates highly in my book! Only significant complaint- rooms need better soundproofing. I was up during the night with an upset stomach and could clearly hear my neighbor who was also having some health issues. Hearing him hack & cough did not help me get back to sleep! Otherwise very nice stay.
reviews.title: Very clean and close to airport

aka: Springhill Suites Marriott Salt Lake City Airport Hotel
description: The SpringHill Suites Salt Lake City Airport offers a complimentary 24-hour shuttle service to the airport. It is also convenient to a number of attractions and can be the perfect starting point for visits to Energy Solutions Arena, Gateway Plaza, Temple Square, and Salt Palace Convention Center. Guest suites are 25% larger than most suites in the area. The property also features a complimentary new breakfast buffet, high-speed Internet Access, indoor pool, and fitness room.
